title: Ticket #4974: condor_gangliad can cause underflows in ganglia RRD
description:
Next time you’re extremely bored, we average about ~130 of these messages every 30 seconds from gmetad on hcc-ganglia. These are the #s that get written to the rrd files, so likely what condor is sending out as well. I’m currently just ignoring it all, but if I tell someone maybe I’ll remember to look at it too -.-

Looks like they’re all just increasingly small numbers - small beyond the float that ganglia expects that is. 

RRD_update (/var/lib/ganglia/rrds/crab-infrastructure/vocms039.cern.ch/FileTransferDownloadBytesPerSecond_5m.rrd): /var/lib/ganglia/rrds/crab-infrastructure/vocms039.cern.ch/FileTransferDownloadBytesPerSecond_5m.rrd: converting '4.44659e-323' to float: Numerical result out of range

RRD_update (/var/lib/ganglia/rrds/crab-infrastructure/vocms009.cern.ch/Owner_cmst1_FileTransferDownloadBytesPerSecond_5m.rrd): /var/lib/ganglia/rrds/crab-infrastructure/vocms009.cern.ch/Owner_cmst1_FileTransferDownloadBytesPerSecond_5m.rrd: converting '5.92879e-323' to float: Numerical result out of range

RRD_update (/var/lib/ganglia/rrds/crab-infrastructure/vocms0304.cern.ch/FileTransferFileWriteLoad_5m.rrd): /var/lib/ganglia/rrds/crab-infrastructure/vocms0304.cern.ch/FileTransferFileWriteLoad_5m.rrd: converting '4.44659e-323' to float: Numerical result out of range
creator: tim
